comment.body: What about evil code in the site itself?

I hope that the "update a cloned site" problem is solvable someday without being a git wizard. 

But evil code in a site I display makes me a little bit uneasy. Can ZeroNet sites be a vector for ransomware or is it save because of the sandbox features of modern browsers?

Thanks for the proxy hint. I now use ZeroNet in a Chrome app where I set a non working proxy. Only drawback is, I have to copy links to the clearnet into another browser.

If you click on a link in Retroshare you are asked whether you really want to visit the site. Maybe it is possible to have a similar feature in ZeroNet. 

No connections to the clearnet by default. If you click a link a "channel" to the internet is opened.
Do we have to activate indexing in our own sites? My site does not show up in the search.
Luckily some static site generators have import functions for wordpress blogs and other systems.

Please forgive my total ignorance, but why do we need id providers in the first place? Each node already has a kind of identity. Why can't we generate a public token/key from our secret key we use to sign our sites?
